page.title: 13LEE MOOR AREA-TOURISM.
page.content: Lee Moor village has little to do with tourism at the moment.Although the village is on the edge of Dartmoor there are no guest houses,hotels, public houses,or tourist attractions. However,it is an area which attracts people on day trips,either walking on the moor (mainly Penn Beacon),pony trekking from Tinpark Farm,or having picnics in the Newpark Wood area.There is a bridleway for walkers or ponies which goes from Tolchmoor Gate to the south-west corner of the grid,another one which goes from Quick Bridge to the bottom of the grid,as well as other footpaths in the Headon China Clay Works area.When china clay extraction has finished it could be that the whole area will be made into a country park,catering for public recreational use.
